snippet: The director of "Newsies," Jeff Calhoun recently told BroadwayWorld.com that "it'll be fun to be with Jeremy again," which was apparently an inadvertent slip on his part, since a moment later Mr. Calhoun lamented that he might get "in trouble" for...
abstract: The director of "Newsies," Jeff Calhoun recently told BroadwayWorld.com that "it'll be fun to be with Jeremy again," which was apparently an inadvertent slip on his part, since a moment later Mr. Calhoun lamented that he might get "in trouble" for saying that.
lead_paragraph: One of the major casting questions pending on Broadway is whether "Newsies," this spring's new Disney musical, will star Jeremy Jordan, whose performance as the newsboy Jack Kelly drew critical acclaim in the show's premiere in New Jersey last year and helped persuade Disney Theatrical Productions to transfer it to New York. Now that Mr. Jordan is free from the Broadway musical "Bonnie & Clyde," which closed on Friday, it's a good bet that he'll be hawking "papes" as Jack on Broadway.

headline.main: Jeremy Jordan On Verge of Joining Broadway Move of Disney's 'Newsies'
